Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: toys9802 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. The traffic is very convenient, airport bus & metro.With buffet breakfast. The price is reasonable. The room is clean comfortably. There is free wi-fi & internet. The staff is nice and the cleaner staff is good service and very nice. Very recommed !

Reviews.Title: “NIce, friendly little restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Julie M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I took my nephew to Barcelona as his 18th birthday present & this hotel was recommended to me. It was only a couple of minutes walk from the bus terminus/las ramblas & we got there very early. Fortunately our room was ready and they let us book in at 10.30am. The room was very nice and we had a little balcony that we sat out on. They even supplied 2 little travel bags of accessories in the bathroom that surprised me for a 1* hotel. We had our own fridge & outside in the hall was a computer that we could use free of charge. The staff were really friendly & helpful. The breakfast was ok, there was a fair selection. Although we didn't eat here (apart from breakfast), the restaurant was very busy during the day with non-residents so maybe worth looking into!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Urquinaona if you don't ask to much about your room on a quite good location”
Reviews.Author: Joan L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the titel of the riveiw says it all Simple, quite good service, close to the center and the ramblas. Room cleaned every day but it coud be better, breakfast okay and enough. Value for your money. Good startingpoint for discovering barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 star”
Reviews.Author: kamgal
Reviews.Content: First time staying in a 1 star and we were very pleased. Checked in early and they stored our luggage. Desk clerk spoke good english. Asked for a quiet room and we got a room at the back and had no noise issues. Room had air con, electronic safe. and flat screen tv as well as two beds very comfortable decent size bathroom and lots of room for 4 suitcases. Breakfast was included in the room rate and the restaurant is attached to the hotel nice variety for breakfast excellent coffee with chocolate croissants and ham and cheese baguettes, juice, fruit,cereal one can eat inside or they have tables outside too which we utilized in the evening to people watch along with a few cold beers. We ate dinner at the restaurant on our first nite and it was very good and reasonably priced. Location is great close to Plaza Catalunya where you can buy a ticket on the hop on off buss which takes you to all the major attractions and also an easy walk to La Ramblas lots of great restaurants in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little modern hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Mattyboi18
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for the first time over New Years Eve (11/12). The staff were very friendly and the rooms were very adequate - with all the amenities you need for a short city break. The staff were also very polite and helpful. The best thing about this stay is when we got back to our room on New Years Eve a complimentary bottle of Champagne had been left in our room! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: ivieong
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided to book 2 nights at Hotel Urquinaona. At the very last minute, we changed our plan and shorterned our stay to 1 night. The change was done without much hassle. Staff was friendly and helpful and we had no problem in communicating with them in English. We were looking for churros and managed to get some recommendations from the staff. The hotel location is great. Walking distance to train and bus stations. Tourist bus station is also within walking distance. So is airport shuttles to Terminal 1 and 2. Walking distance to La Rambla and Bari Gothic. Room wise, we got a queen size bed plus a single bed. So we had more than enough space for stuff. Cabinets were a little run down but toilet was big and bright enough. It seemed have undergone some toilet renovations maybe. The common area on 1st floor was tidy and neat. The room came with breakfast. It was decent and great to sit outside early in the morning to watch the city waking up. I was expecting maybe some croissant and coffee. It was more than that! There were some fruits, and we could choose one of the pastries/muffins from the pastry case, plus fresh brewed coffee. If you are on sight-seeing trip, this is the place where you get what you need - shower & rest.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a quiet room at the back.”
Reviews.Author: OD
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location right near the downtown, with an excellent restaurant downstairs where we had dinner. Included continental breakfast was coffee with cheese, ham and bread. We also sat at the outdoor tables in front of the main doors to have drinks in the early evening and people watch - that was fun. It was an easy walk to the subway, thence to go anywhere in the city. My husband and I had room 203 at the back and it was quiet. I am very easily awakened even by small noises, but we both slept well. The rooms on the front of the building overlook the busy street, and I understand tend to be noisy. Our room was small but adequate. We heard water noises from the drains; this was mainly heard in the morning when people above were showering. The water from upper floors runs through pipes in the walls, but it is an older building after all. I heard no rumbling or noise from the subway beneath the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great prices, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: BelfastLampost66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in this hotel. Location: right over the metro. So be prepared to be woken up by trams at 5 AM. If you are a heavy sleeper, then it does not matter. Rooms: small, but you do not want to stay in your room in Barcelona. Good effective air conditioning. Rooms cleaned everyday. Staff: very helpful, cheerful and speak good english. Breakfast: Good Free wifi and free computer. Overall reasonable prices 119 euros for a quad room. If you want bigger rooms, Le meridian is a short distance away with 450 per night or 375 if booked well in advance. Will I stay there again: Yes

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay but not great.”
Reviews.Author: xavier16
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights total here, one pre-cruise and two nights post-cruise. This was the cheapest hotel I could find that will accomodate four that is relatively near Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. We paid about E170 per night which is still quite steep for what you get, but I presume prices are usually higher for hotels in the summer anyway due to influx of visitors. Let me start with the Positives: The hotel's location is great. As I mentioned, it is near Placa Catalunya, which is the heart of the city. Maybe a five to ten minute walk. It's also ten minutes to La Rambla, and I'm glad I didn't pick a hotel there as it's more expensive and La Rambla is quite unpleasant in my own opinion. It's also quite near the Catedral and Barri Gotic. There are also lots of food options in the area, plenty cheap otions for those who are budget-conscious. The metro is also a minute walk from the hotel, which though we only used once, I would presume will be helpful for others. I felt safe in the area, though somebody warned us that it is pickpocket central especially in La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. (No issues though for us). The people manning the front desk are generally nice and helpful. They all speak great english so communicating with them is not a problem. The man on our last day though did not speak english but was still helpful. Since we were leaving early for the airport and breakfast starts at 8, he gave us several croissants to go, which I felt was a nice touch by the hotel. For a 1 star hotel, the amenities in the rooms are great. There's an electronic safe in the room, a big flat screen TV that at least has CNN, airconditioning in the room, free fast WIFI, and private bathrooms. There is also an elevator in the hotel. Breakfast is also provided though it's only continental breakfast but enough to get you by in the morning. Now for the negatives: on our first night, the airconditioning was not working too well. Rooms got very stuffy so we had to open the window. We complained about this but I think they just thought we didn't know how to operate the AC. We were staying just one night at that time anyway so didn't make a fuss. They placed us on a different room when we came back from the cruise and thankfully the AC Is working perfectly. Though this room was in a worse shape than our previous room. There were black spots and molds in the shower ceiling which really looked gross. Also, the sheets were also not very clean. Considering that the rooms were just renovated last year, they didn't look very new to me. Also, the elevator is creaky, which freaked us out the first time, but we soon got used to it. There was also once that the elevator doors won't close! We got out, tried it again, and thankfully it didn't malfunction. We still used it for the duration of the trip, but I used the stairs when I didn't have any company as I was afraid, God forbid, I get stuck alone. Overall the hotel is just okay. I would stay there again if I was on a budget and staying in Barcelona for only a few days as the pros overcome the cons. Is it good value for money? Hmm not too sure about that as we still paid quite a lot considering it is a one star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Got a single bedroom for the price of a Double, unacceptable!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edgar075_11
Reviews.Content: I just want to advice people who want to stay in this hotel to be careful regarding the room they get. My wife and I have asked for a double room for a night and we got a single with a double bed instead and got charged the same price €80. We have tried to explain to them that it was unacceptable; they were trying to convince us that it was a double bedroom even after showing them the floor layout plan behind the door showing that this room was way more tiny that the others and with one bed on the Plan. So be careful to not get the room 401! It was as well fool of marks on the walls and the shower tray was clogged and it was facing the street so very noisy. I really not recommend this hotel to anyone! We also met a couple from Quebec after checking out and they weren’t very happy and were complaining about this hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend Hotel Urquinaona!”
Reviews.Author: pripires2009
Reviews.Content: I spent sometime in this hotel and it was great! The staff are friendly . The room is very clean. The location is perfect, the breakfast is simple, but very good! You can stay there, its ok!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and value”
Reviews.Author: Alejo07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights, three days. the location was central and easily walkable by Metro (which in Barcelona is excellent) from the airport you can take a shuttle which is cheap and maybe have to walk half a block and you're there. the front desk was nice he held our bags until check in so we could walk through the city before check-in. the rooms are clean and furnished, beds, TV's. the bathroom had towels, keep in mind this is a budget hotel, not everything matched but that's not important for me. breakfast is included which is in the bar/cafe next door. when returning to Barcelona i will be staying there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place - would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: dee_swam
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was the third stop after Madrid and Ibiza on our 2010 trip to Spain and France. We are 3 couples in our 20s from Bombay. Hotel Urquinaona scores very highly thanks to its great location and friendly service. It is a block away from the Plaza Catalunya hub and 3 blocks from the cultural smorgaboard that's Las Ramblas. It is also just above a metro station - Urquinaona - which is connected to two lines. Special mention for the service - the desk and the staff at the restaurant next door (where we had breakfast on all four days) - are really sweet and helpful. The rooms and shower are comfortable and clean... although most of them don't have a great view. But who needs a view in Barcelona - the most delighful and vibrant city I've been to in Europe so far. There is free internet on a computer in the common area on the first floor. Enough number of eateries, pubs, shopping places and grocery stores nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jorgenwesterberg
Reviews.Content: Room 203 on the inner with 3 beds. Nice and clean, tv, fridge, aircondition, good beds. Not big, no great view, silent. We tried 301 with balcony on the streetside but impossible to sleep on friday saturday when a club over the street was noisy till 6 a´clock. No problem to change back to 203. Breakfast with small and big sandwiches with ham, salami, cheese, croissant, sweet pastries, excellent coffee, juice, fresh fruit, cornflakes and choco. I don´t need more. Excellent restaurant. Very helpful staff. Very priceworth. Very close to where all things happen at Placa Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: tmd32
Reviews.Content: The hotel reception staff were very pleasant however this did not extend to the bar/restaurant. The breakfast was extremeley poor and dumped on the end of the bar, the breakfast area was shabby whilst the restaurant at the rear of the hotel was empty. The bar waiter in the evening had a terrible attitude and refused to serve anyone after 11.30pm as he had better things to do and literally stood over a table of 4 who had spent the whole evening at this establishment until they finished their dinks and left. Our room was at the rear of the hotel and had no view apart from some brickwork, the room was dark and airless, the trains on the metro could be heard constantly. We normally stay in 3 or 4 star hotels but as we had a busy schedule and would be out of the hotel most of the time we thought things would not be too bad. They were and we soon moved on to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with great staff”
Reviews.Author: h0ls2009
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed for 3 nights. We had one or two problems during our stay and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms were nice with flat screen tv(we listened to the radio rather than watch the tv). Two of our rooms had a lovely balcony as well. The real treat was the bathrooms which had a fantastic shower. All in all this hotel is in a good location, it's in a quiet area but within minutes of the Rambla and all the night life. The breakfast in the attached restaurant is also lovely and served til 11.30am. I'd highly recommend this hotel for a break in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “This is a perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: likestravel_10
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, walking to everything plus the Metro at your doorstep. Great value, even at height of season. Lovely room with balcony, modern bath and great shower, fridge, safe, breakfast included, free internet and computer in the lounge area. Desk staff were very helpful and could answer any question. Added plus of an excellent restaurant attached. A great boutique hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If u are looking for the small hotel in the center of Barcelona, this is one of the good chioce which I recommend”
Reviews.Author: k_annieItaly
Reviews.Content: As I stayed in this hotel for my vacation with all my family, I would say that it' s such a comfortable hotel for many things. Because this hotel just renovated and it's mordern and very clean, In the room, it has safety box and flat screen television that usually the small hotel haven't offer this kinds of thing. Moreover, the restuarant in the hotel is very good and u can eat the real Spanish taste. The hotel is very close to the center area which u could go every attractive place or shopping area. I haven't got any problem about children during i'm stayed in this hotel, all staff is very kind. I could say this hotel is perfect to choose to stayed and i'm surely to come back to stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem & great service”
Reviews.Author: soppa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urguinaona web site didn't look too promising and thus it was very very pleasant surprise. The staff was very nice, friendly and personal. Breakfast was good quality and relaxed and the room itself was really clean and stylish. I stayed at 501 (top floor) and I had really huge terrace in my room. Wow! The room itself is not that roomy but very ok for e.g. business travellers or people like me -- spending 4-5 days in Barcelona. It is located just a block from Plaza Catalynua (this is where airport bus will drop you). It is walking distance from Rambla, old town etc. The hotel is next to a park and rather quiet. I paid 59 euros per night and it definitely was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MsSmiley89
Reviews.Content: Having gone to Barcelona with my boyfriend for the Grand Prix and struggling to find a hotel within our budget, we stumbled upon Hotel Urquinaona and booked it. The fact that it was classed as a 1* hotel meant we were not expecting much, but we were extremely (and pleasantly) surprised. We arrived quite late, but check-in was prompt and we were very happy with our room. The decor of the room is extremely modern and funky, and it was kept clean throughout our 5 night stay. There is a flat-screen on the wall: note there is not one English channel: not a problem for us as it was quite fun trying to work out the news in Spanish). A small balcony looks out onto the main street which can be loud in the night if you are a light sleeper, but with so much to do in Barcelona, we were extremely tired out by the time we had our dinner. A fridge is also provided which we filled with snacks from the supermarket 2 minutes away (told to us by the friendly receptionist). Breakfast was lovely; taken in the restaurant next door, with a selection of juice, cereal, pastries, sandwiches, coffees and tea. It is not buffet but enough to keep you going until it is time for a mid-morning snack or lunchtime. The staff on the reception were brilliant; they were always extremely friendly and kind and willing to go the extra mile to help us understand the Barcelona transport system! Note: This is one of those hotels where you leave your key at the front desk, and the doors have to be opened and closed by the receptionist, therefore making you feel very safe. There is also a computer on the first floor with free internet, and given the size of the hotel, we were able to quickly check our emails everyday. The area itself was spot-on, right in the centre of Barcelona, with a metro stop practically on the doorstep, and placa catalunya a mere few blocks away. Once you get to grips with the metro system, it is very easy to use and a useful tip is to buy a one day travelcard (called T-Dia on the ticket machines) which will get you anywhere you want to go regarding attractions such as Nou Camp or Sagrada Familia. Overall, we had a brilliant time, enjoyed the Grand Prix and had a few days left over to explore Barcelona. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and will be staying here again next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wannatravel1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 12 girls on a hen weekend and wanted somewhere cheap & cheerful. I checked trip advisor prior to booking & thought It's not exactly modern or very well presented but its central! However..... We arrived and the whole place had just had a complete overhaul. It was bright, funky & modern. We had double & triple rooms booked and all were immaculate, beds made & towels changed daily, flat screen on the wall, electronic safe, extra blankets, air con and we were all presented with a rose on arrival! Breakfast was cereal, pastry O.J & coffee & fresh fruit. We used the bar attatched which was reasonable howver not the restaurant but the menu looked good & also well priced. The location is superb, less than a minuite to Urquinaona metro stop & 3 blocks walk to Placa Catalunya. The staff were friendly & welcoming. Ignore all old photos & check out the ones dated April 2010. Highly recomended if you want clean, central and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “reservation canceled”
Reviews.Author: OrsiBBudapest
Reviews.Content: we reservered two single rooms on the internet 6 weeks before travel. after arrival to the hotel we learned that the rooms were "under water", but no problem, they offered an alternative quite close and cheaper, but call them if we are not fine with that. in the hotel suggested, we were shown a cabin (6 sqm + broom) with windows to a firewall. so we left and called. they were sorry, but if that hotel is not ok, we have to find another option ourselves. i tried to explain that at 6 pm after a long flight with a program tomorrow morning it is not really what i wanted, same answer 3 times. i simply do not recommend hotel urqionaona!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: CulturalTravelGuide
Reviews.Content: I have 3 musts: Cleanliness, private bathroom, service. Cleanliness: Clean enough. Private bathroom: Yes, with a tub. Service: Good, although the guy at the reception desk is a bit defensive if you ask anything. Pros: - Allowed us to check-in before the check-in time, so that we could go do sightseeing just after we arrived. - Very well located, just two blocks from Plaza Catalunya and metro station a few steps away. - Breakfast is included. - Electronic safe box in the room and free wi-fi (When it worked, which was most of the time). - Reasonably priced. Cons: - Gave us four single beds instead of one double sized bed, like we had asked, and then acted as if hat was not a problem (Honestly, we were so eager to go out, that we didn't mind, but... this is not ok). - It looked like the shower water from the room next door was coming back through our shower one night. Disgusting, but it didn't happen again. - Old building, musty smell and tile floors which makes it cold. - No view (But really, who cares?).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location great price”
Reviews.Author: bumpynen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during La Merce---a week long festival in Barcelona, which I highly recommend attending. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and very competitively priced. We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was a little bit small but we weren't there much and it was just myself and my girlfriend, so we were pleased. The location is great, a short walk to Plaza de Catalunya and the Ramblas. The street is wide, open, and in a safe part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “for the price very nice”
Reviews.Author: akweiss07
Reviews.Content: location was great, a metro only 3 meter away quite at night and not expensive. rooms are basic but staff is friendly, and breakfast is good, enough for the Spanish life.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, central but quiet. Decent breakfast too.”
Reviews.Author: WanderingAngeus
Reviews.Content: This is a one star hotel & should be judged accordingly. That said it comes out well. Check in at 23:00 was fine,so we took the very slow lift to a room on the second floor which was clean modest sized. So was the bathroom. A standard tiny tv mounted on a wall had poor reception . The window looked out onto another building. We were there for a city break of four nights so tv & views didn't interest us. There was supposed to be a complimentary bottle of cava for us on arrival & when this was pointed out to the night porter he was genuinely apologetic & promised us one for the next day instead. Sure enough, that's what happened. Breakfast in the restaurant next door to reception was very good for continental europe, this isn't bacon & eggs country. Urquinoana roundel/square is at the edge of the medival city & close to the shopping districts of the new city, a 5min walk to the top of Las Ramblas. The area felt safe at night as does a lot of the city. Places to eat are too numerous to mention & the restaurant downstairs is certainly not one star with a good menu & cellar. There is a metro stop literally outside the door which makes sight seeing on a short break much easier. I would recommend taking a metro on the out trip, then working your way back on foot, though the city is so compact it's not needed other than as a time saving device. The old city , Park Guiel & The Sagrada Familia in all it's unfinished glory are must sees, after that it's whatever you like. Night life is everywhere but we found Las Ramblas a little overpriced & a bit seedy at night. We were glad we didn't book a hotel there, ok to visit but nice to leave. Ironically we found the most popular place for the locals was an Irish bar across the roundel/square from the hotel. Can't remember it's name. Smoking in the bar, non smoking in the big back lounge. The bar seemed to be popular with young Americans. The lounge bar had live music sometimes followed by a DJ. Lively later on! Overall this hotel is fine for a few nights for people who are there to explore the city & not the staying in types. Faultless location Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JVFLondon
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, really good value. Only 70 euros a night and this included free breakfast, free internet and, best of all, a free bottle of cava nicely chilled in our room upon arrival. Staff were friendly and helpful. room was nice. Loction excellent. Only down side was noisy construction work going on next door but hat is hardly their fault and won't last long. i'll def be back to stay there if i return to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Urquinaona”
Reviews.Author: cross_cultural_Qatar
Reviews.Content: My three day stay at the Urquinaona was great. I arrived after a long flight and was tired. I didn't know how to work the heating in the room and the attendant came up to show me how. Everything worked fine and the bathroom/shower was in perfect running order. The breakfast was adequate, nothing fancy, but it was fine for a complimentary hotel breakfast. The hotel restaurant was also good as I had dinner there one night. The staff were terrific offering suggestions on what to see/do, gave good directions, and helped in whatever way possible. I paid my bill the night before and checked out the next day. A taxi was arrived at the time I specified. I highly recommend this hotel for LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Good for shopping, catching the tour bus at Plaza Catalunya, and some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best 1 star Ever!”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: Was a little hesitant to book this hotel as it was only a one star, however am glad I did. Getting to the hotel from BCN airport was extremely easy as you take the AEROBUS to Pl. Catalunya (under 4 euros), where the hotel is only a short walk away. Check in was easy and we were up to our rooms. The hallways were completely shaddy. The room was a lot better; I was relieved when I saw the room to see it was not as bad as the hallway. Room was clean, the bathroom was in good working order, aircon worked great, and they give you a free bottle of sparkling wine. The view was hilarious…. you looked onto someone else’s apartment, a little awkward to open the window and see some kid playing video games. We also found that long distance calls were extremely cheap. The breakfast was good…. for free…. it was served in the bar next door. Location was excellent you could walk to tons of places. Front desk was helpful with suggestion. We were leaving for the airport at 3 am and advised the front desk the night before…were told to pay that night as the overnight staff did not know how to use visa, also asked if we could have snacks as we would not be able to have breakfast, which they gladly gave us. Next morning our cab was ready and we were on our way. Excellent location, Excellent value…. you forget about everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....but, when we went to check out....”
Reviews.Author: Sara161616
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here for our entire stay in Barcelona. While I didn't mind the hotel for the respite of my stay, although it was very sparse, felt kind of cell-like, and the shower could have been cleaner, I wouldn't have felt like I had a bad experience there until I went to check out. We had to catch a flight for Madrid, and needed to check out at 4:00 a.m in order to do so. The front desk clerks the night before we left said it would be no problem, and arranged a cab to come pick us up. So, I was quite surprised and taken aback when I went to check out with my credit card and the new front desk clerk (who was not who arranged the cab for us) and who looked quite shady, demanded that I pay in cash because he didn't know how to work the credit card machine. He wanted me to go around and get hundreds of dollars out of an ATM in the dark. More than even my bank will let me take out! I was livid to say the least. I explained that I reserved with my credit card, and they could charge it later if they couldn't get it to work at the time. I was not handing over cash to this guy. He kept arguing with me, and wouldn't let me talk to a manager. It felt like a scam. Luckily the cab driver was able to help the guy work the machine, but it was while the meter was running, so we ended up paying more for a taxi, and almost missed our flight. Then I was worried the whole flight back that my card would be charged several times, or that this individual now had my information. It was very unsettling. Luckily, it was charged once, but the worry it caused wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: donna035
Reviews.Content: It is always a gamble when you book a hotel on-line, but I was very pleased with this one. It had everything we needed, was in a great location and the staff helped out as much as they could. Thanks for the lovely stay in Barcelona (and of course the Cava)!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: wown15
Reviews.Content: In traveling, I have always looked for the bargain...my view is, why spend all that money on a hotel when you are only going to be there to sleep and shower. And until my stay at Hotel Urquinaona, I had never been disappointed with a bargain hotel. Let's start with the pros. The hotel is about five steps from the metro station and you can easily walk to different parts of the city; the water was hot when all three of us took turns showering. Now the cons...the room was by far the tinyest room i have ever stayed at. Literally the three of us had to put our suitcase on our beds in order to be able to open them. Secondly we had a window that faced another building about a foot away, i felt like i was in a cell. The bathroom had no sink space and the tub had mold all over it. We saw some spiders and our last day there we woke up to someone screaming, we still have no idea what that was all about. And at this point i was still "ok" with the room. The tipping point was what the staff demanded when we left. Let me preface this by stating that the night before we asked to have a taxi requested at 4:00a.m. The staff said it would be no problem and when we booked the hotel we were told we could pay with credit card. Well imagine our surprise when at 3:30 a.m. the staff member states he doesn't know how to work the credit card machine and that we need to walk to an atm and retrieve 450 dollars. The three of us are all young and in our twenties, the last thing we were going to do was walk five blocks in the pitch dark and get that amount of cash. We insisted to speak with a manager since they already had our card number and were still demanding that we go to the atm. The staff member refused to call the manager at home. The cab driver came in and thankfully helped explain that it would be unsafe to walk to the atm and that we could not be expected to have that kind of cash. Luckily the cab driver taught the man how to use the machine, but we ended up having to pay the cab driver for his time anyway because the meter was running. We would never stay here again and we would never recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, budget appropriate!”
Reviews.Author: FancyTraveler10
Reviews.Content: My best friend & I met in Barcelona and booked this hotel for the whole stay (89 E. per night). We easily booked it right off the website. When you get off the plane, there's a bus right outside the airport (its a nice bus & it's only 4 Euros) to take you to Catalunya Square & from there its just a short walk to the hotel. Our room was on the 3rd floor, not big, but fine for us. The bathroom was clean, tub, shower, mini-wall hair dryer, etc. And, of course, the big bonus, a bottle of Cava awaited us in the mini-fridge! We drank it on the porch later that night. The only little gripe I had was the bars are open there until 5AM and those kids paarrrttyyy. We like to have a good time, too, but we are in our early '30's and it was just a bit too much. Honestly, we wish we would've gone to Seville or some smaller city in Spain where we could've really enjoyed the food & culture. Barcelona was a very international city, with different languages flying everywhere and it's a very 20-something party town (and $$$). But we still had a good time and this hotel rocked our needs and our budget. The next door cafe was perfect for our (free!) morning breakfast. One last note, don't eat on Las Ramblas!! They'll overcharge you so find the little places (in Born) to have Spanish fare. You all are lucky you have me to tell you what I wish someone told me! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterFairy
Reviews.Content: We were wanting a cheap long weekend away in Barcelona - we began looking for hotels and thought that there was no way we were going to keep it cheap in a good location to view the city. Then we found Hotel Urquinaona!! It was cheap, only one star so we weren't sure. After looking online the reviews were good and so we thought we'd go for it. And we were so glad we did! Its a small hotel with possibly maximum of 12 rooms, everyday each room is cleaned and the linen is changed. Each room has a fridge (which had a free bottle of bubbly when we arrived!), a safe and ours had a balcony!! There was a cafe/bar next door which is where you get breakfast. The tube stop is 2 second walk away and we got the Aerobus to the airport which is in Catalyn Square about a 5 minutes walk away or one stop on the tube. We saw everything by travelling on the tube so what location could have been better?! The people were lovely, very friendly and very helpful. Our flight wasnt until midnight on the Weds but they allowed us to store our bags under the stairs free of charge until we wanted to collect them! We will recommend this hotel to anyone, and Barcelona was beautiful! Thank you very much!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: boullaylestroux
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for visiting Barcelona. Our room was pretty small, the bathroom was almost as large as the room but there was also a cute little balcony for viewing the street life below. I'd searched the web and using Trip Advisor had seen lots of good reviews for this hotel -- and I agree with other reviewers on the very good points of this hotel. The Hotel Urquinaona offered just what we wanted for a 3 night stay... we were out all day and just dropped into bed each night after tapas and tapas and sightseeing. There was a free wifi connection in the room and a free interenet computer just outside our door as well, plus a free bottle of red wine in the fridge. I've rarely seen a bottle of wine offered in 4 or 5 star hotels and often the more stars a hotel has the more it costs for Internet. Kudos to Hotel Urquinaona for a wonderful stay. Don't be put off by the 'just' one star listing for this hotel. Hotels in Barcelona are pricey and parking even more so. We drove down from Paris so the car needed to be in a parking lot... well, there was a public car park 50 meters from the hotel that cost nearly as much as our room for our stay. This hotel does not have its own parking, but it is a minor point. The hotel staff - on duty 24/24 were very helpful and mutlilingual and the cafe just next door was perfect for breakfast or an afternoon drink though this street side cafe was a bit noisy perhaps, or just a nice city sound. It'll depend on your mood. This is a modest hotel in a big city at a fair price. Yes, I have stayed in bigger rooms for less in France and other countries, but they were way out in the middle of nada, nulle part, nowhere. If you're looking for value for money and don't need a huge room to spread out in, and/or you are not planning on being in the hotel for much more than a siesta or short nights (you'll be in the tapas bars, restaurants, museums, wandering about almost all day in any case, won't you?)... then I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: hapitripper
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and convenient. It was about a 5-7min walk to Placa Catalunya and las Ramblas. The room is clean and always cleaned in a timely manner. They also serve a substantial breakfast next door. When you make your reservation be sure to request for a room in the front (we did not do this so we got the wall of the next building as a view outside our window) The front desk person that checked us in was friendly and helpful. I am not so sure about the other person as she does not even look at us. Overall a good stay, the best was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: denver17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in May of 2006. We are on a budget and did a lot of research on one and two star hotels in Barcelona prior to our trip. We finally decided on this little hotel due to its location, amenities and price of 90 Euros. This small, basic hotel was very centrally located and offered ample room space, a mini fridge with a free bottle of cava (their sparking wine), a full sized bathroom and a balcony overlooking the colorful street below. Breakfast was served in the adjoining cafe every morning and was pleasant and plentiful. The maid service was outstanding and the staff was friendly. One thing we loved about this hotel was the heavy drapes that we pulled across the balcony doors every afternoon for our siesta. They literally blocked out all light and any noise from the street, and provided pleasant surroundings for a much needed daily nap after touring the city and enjoying the nightlife. I would definitely recommed this hotel to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swathes
Reviews.Content: OK, since using TripAdvisor last year to find a hotel in New York - I knew of only one place to look for a Barcelona hotel and that was Trip Advisor. I strongly advise using Trip Advisor rather than looking at Expedia Recommends etc before booking anywhere to stay. Firstly, we were just looking for a budget type hotel. Nothing too tatty, and that we (my girlfriend and I) felt safe in. That is definately what you get with this hotel. Upon arriving in Barcelona and braving the train to the city centre and juggling the underground we appeared from the subway and felt a bit lost as the signage sometimes isn't obvious. Didn't have to go far - as, no word of a lie, the hotel was about 30 foot from the underground. Excellent transport links. Easy check-in. The guy on the desk was very friendly. However, at this stage I was still worried as to whether or not NY was a fluke and this was going to be a dump of a hotel. I was pleasntly surprised! Upon taking a rough ride in the small lift (it makes a few noises - but can carry lots - so don't worry) we found our room. We had air con, a hair dryer and plenty of space in the room. Our own bathroom. (It was a bit small with the beeday (can't spell) in there) but you can manage well enough. We even had a great free bottle of Cava in the fridge which we thorougily enjoyed. The room was clean and made every day. It included plenty of storage and a safe within the room. I really felt as though I could leave my valuables. Nobody is just going to walk into the hotel - as the door is controlled manually. ( You may have to knock on arrival!) The hotel is on a sometimes busy road - but I found it pretty easy to sleep... Especially after opening the door and nipping out onto the small balcony for an ice cold beer! ;-) Breakfast was served in the restaurant next door - not much, but enough to keep you going. If you are a greedy man like me, you will probably want something else abour 11am. The hotel is ideally located to the underground and a few minutes walk to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas. We used the transfer from Placa Catalunya to get to the airport. Cheap - and not far to get there. In all, I would recommend this to couples who aren't too fussed about comfort and want somewhere to feel safe and crash at night. Saying that though - the hotel and room were very clean. Thanks very much HOTEL URQUINAONA for a memorable visit to Barcelona. I will definately be back to stay again. 1 star hotel - but 5 star service!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located - Hotel Urquinaona was great”
Reviews.Author: WyomingRocks
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urquinaona was great - we booked this off of other Trip Advisor comments and were very impressed. The rooms were clean and simple - nothing flashy - no great style. The double beds were actually two single beds - which is typical for Europe - so don't be surprised. We stayed in a room at the back of the hotel which did face another building - so not a lot of sunlight - but defintely quiet. However, the real reason to stay at this hotel is the location. Location, location, location. It really was "centrally" located in between all the things you want to see in Barcelona. Although you are just steps from the Metro - you can walk almost everywhere. In 10 or 15 minutes we walked up to the Sagrada Familia. 5 or 10 Minutes and your down in the Gothic Quarter - a few more streets over and your walking down Las Ramblas. There are fantastic restaruants just a few blocks from the hotel like [Casa Calvet - C/ de Casp 48, Smart. Trad decor. High-end trad food. Gaudi building. Romantic. Expensive] or for a great roast lamb try [Restaurant Asador de Aranda C/ Pau Claris 70, Eixample Derecha. simple decor. Trad simple roasts. Mid-price.] The shopping nearby was also excellent. Lastly, the basic breakfast that was included in the price of the room, we thought was fantastic. Every morning, in the cafe - next to the hotel - we had a cafe con leche with fresh squeezed orange juice, a croissant and a roll with Jamon Serrano (ham)- just writing it makes me want to go back. We couldn't have been happier with a hotel anywhere - especially once you consider the price. We have already recommended it to several friends who will be traveling there soon - and to all who read this.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Urquinaona
HotelInfo.Address: Ronda de Sant Pere 24, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
